title: Being Mortal

description: FRONTLINE reports from inside the deadliest Ebola outbreak on record.

description: The life and death of the woman whose image remains a potent symbol for those who want to keep the Iranian reform movement alive.

description: Investigating the dramatic story of how, in just six months, America's financial system unraveled....

description: A rich personal and political biography of America's 44th president and what has brought him to this historic moment...

description: The compelling saga of one family's efforts to rebuild their homes, and their lives, in post-Katrina New Orleans

description: He believes he is destined to change Venezuela and the whole of Latin America. Who is Hugo Chávez, and where is he headed?

description: A far-reaching investigation into America's energy landscape and what can be done to save our planet - and what it will take.

title: The Choice 2008
description: The story of two unlikely presidential contenders and what they say about America.

description: A remarkably intimate look into the lives of nine young Chinese coming of age in a society changing as fast as any in history.

description: In the debate over health care, what might the U.S. learn from the successes and failures of five other capitalist democracies?

description: Investigating Vice President Cheney's role as chief architect in the war on terror and his internal war with George Tenet's CIA...

description: Face to face with insurgents in Iraq, FRONTLINE investigates who they are and why they fight.

description: Examining the failures at every level of government in the Hurricane Katrina disaster. Could it happen again?

description: An eye-opening look at the power and influence of the world's largest company.

description: An inside look at the multibillion-dollar business and science of selling us on what we want.

description: What explains the surge in behavior-modifying drugs for children? How safe -- and necessary -- are they?

description: A look at how America's giant media corporations skillfully court the teenage consumer.

description: The intimate story of a high school shooter and what led Kip Kinkel to kill his parents and then open fire on his classmates.

description: The story of the life of Jesus and the epic rise of Christianity. Said one critic: " It's a revelation of what television can be."

description: A remarkable three-hour film tells the homecoming story of two elderly Polish-American Jews who return to their families' shtetl

description: One year into the Republican revolution, FRONTLINE presents an investigative biography of House Speaker Newt Gingrich.

title: Memory of the Camps
description: No one who has seen this documentary can ever forget it . One critic said it has the power "to shake the soul."

title: A Class Divided
description: One of the most requested programs in FRONTLINE's history - the story of a teacher's daring lesson in discrimination.
